extends Object
implements ScanListenner, SpiderListener, GenericScanner2

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpiderScan

        @Deprecated
public SpiderScan(ExtensionSpider extension,
                              SpiderParam spiderParams,
                              Target target,
                              org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI spiderURI,
                              User scanUser,
                              int scanId)
        Deprecated. (2.6.0) Use SpiderScan(ExtensionSpider, SpiderParam, Target, URI, User, int, String) instead.
        Constructs a SpiderScan with the given data.
        Parameters:
        extension - the extension to obtain configurations and notify the view
        spiderParams - the spider options
        target - the spider target
        spiderURI - the starting URI, may be null.
        scanUser - the user to be used in the scan, may be null.
        scanId - the ID of the scan

      • SpiderScan

        public SpiderScan(ExtensionSpider extension,
                  SpiderParam spiderParams,
                  Target target,
                  org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI spiderURI,
                  User scanUser,
                  int scanId,
                  String name)
        Constructs a SpiderScan with the given data.
        Parameters:
        extension - the extension to obtain configurations and notify the view
        spiderParams - the spider options
        target - the spider target
        spiderURI - the starting URI, may be null.
        scanUser - the user to be used in the scan, may be null.
        scanId - the ID of the scan
        name - the name that identifies the target
        Since:
        2.6.0

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the scan.

        The call to this method has no effect if the scan was already started.

      • pauseScan

        public void pauseScan()
        Pauses the scan.

        The call to this method has no effect if the scan is not running.

        Specified by:
        pauseScan in interface GenericScanner2

      • resumeScan

        public void resumeScan()
        Resumes the scan.

        The call to this method has no effect if the scan is not paused.

        Specified by:
        resumeScan in interface GenericScanner2

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan()
        Stops the scan.

        The call to this method has no effect if the scan was not yet started or has already finished.

        Specified by:
        stopScan in interface GenericScanner2

      • spiderComplete

        public void spiderComplete(boolean successful)
        Description copied from interface: SpiderListener
        Event triggered when the spider is finished. This event is triggered either when the spider has completed scanning a website, in which case the parameter successful is true , either when it was stopped by an user in which case the successful parameter is false.
        Specified by:
        spiderComplete in interface SpiderListener
        Parameters:
        successful -
        • true - when the spider has scanned a website completely and finished by its own
        • false - when the spider was stopped by the user

      • spiderProgress

        public void spiderProgress(int percentageComplete,
                           int numberCrawled,
                           int numberToCrawl)
        Description copied from interface: SpiderListener
        Event triggered when the Spider progress has changed.
        Specified by:
        spiderProgress in interface SpiderListener
        Parameters:
        percentageComplete - the percentage complete
        numberCrawled - the number of pages crawled
        numberToCrawl - the number of pages left to crawl

      • foundURI

        public void foundURI(String uri,
                     String method,
                     FetchFilter.FetchStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: SpiderListener
        Event triggered when a new uri was found. The status parameter says if the URI was skipped according to any skip rule or it was processed.
        Specified by:
        foundURI in interface SpiderListener
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        method - the method used for accessing the uri
        status - the FetchFilter.FetchStatus stating if this uri will be processed, and, if not, stating the reason of the filtering
